en.purpose: To calculate the total Child-Pugh score and assign the corresponding Child-Pugh class based on clinical and laboratory parameters.
en.use:
Use to assess liver function severity in adult patients with chronic liver disease or cirrhosis.

The Child-Pugh score is calculated by assigning 1-3 points to each of the following parameters:
- Serum bilirubin
- INR
- Serum albumin
- Ascites severity
- Hepatic encephalopathy grade

The total score (5–15 points) is used to classify liver function into:
- Child-Pugh A (5–6 points)
- Child-Pugh B (7–9 points)
- Child-Pugh C (≥10 points)
en.misuse: Not to be used as a standalone assessment for treatment selection or surgical eligibility.
